name: engrossment

engrossment noun
(DOCUMENT)
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ C ]
  law
  specialized the final version of a legal document: The top copy should be retained and used as the engrossment if its terms are approved.
More examplesFewer examplesThe tenant's solicitor has to check the engrossment against the agreed form attached to the agreement for lease. The parties' advisers encourage the parties to have one final read through the engrossments before execution. It's common now to type the top copy on an engrossment print, and to invite the buyer to use this as the engrossment.

engrossment noun
(ATTENTION)
[ U ] a feeling of great interest that makes you give something all of your attention: I watched the show with total engrossment.engrossment in She was made more and more uncomfortable by their cosy laughing and engrossment in her medical report.
More examplesFewer examples"Reading" or "looking" can mean anything from a quick flip through to total engrossment.The tension in the painting is universal: engrossment versus boredom.
